remarks:
The Principle of Transfinite Induction.  Theorem 7.17 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 39.  This principle states that if ` A ` is a class of ordinal numbers with the property that every ordinal number included in ` A ` also belongs to ` A ` , then every ordinal number is in ` A ` . See theorem ~ tfindes or ~ tfinds for the version involving basis and induction hypotheses.  (Contributed by NM, 18-Feb-2004.) 

---

This principle states that if ` A ` is a class of ordinal numbers with the property that every ordinal number included in ` A ` also belongs to ` A ` , then every ordinal number is in ` A ` . statement:
tfi $p |- ( ( A C_ On /\ A. x e. On ( x C_ A -> x e. A ) ) -> A = On ) $.
$d A x $.
